  "risk_reasons": [
    "Requester is hiding behind a VPN while the approver is not. One-sided VPN usage is a common concealment tactic and raises location-mismatch concerns.",

    "The requested operation (OPEN_BANK_ACCOUNT) is marked HIGH sensitivity, so every anomaly carries more weight.",

    "High rejection count plus a first-time requester device and VPN usage form a reinforcing cluster of risk—suggesting someone may be cycling devices/IPs to bypass earlier denials.",
    "No positive corroborating signals (matching city, familiar device session, consistent historical location, etc.) were supplied to offset the anomalies."
  ],
  "overall_assessment": "Multiple reinforcing anomalies—VPN-masked requester, first-time device, and an unusually high volume of recent rejections for the same high-sensitivity operation—strongly suggest that the requester could be impersonating the citizen rather than acting on the approver’s behalf.",
